titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Daniel A. Nelson Bicentennial collection, 1923-1989 (bulk 1975-1977)
titlestmt.author: Processed by Laura Uglean Jackson

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Uglean Jackson August 2009

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: The Daniel A. Nelson Bicentennial collection contains subject files, publications, articles, events, memorabilia and merchandise for America's bicentennial celebration in 1976. In addition, there is miscellaneous material from the mid 1970s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: This collection has been minimally processed and arranged in two series.

bioghist.head: Biography of Daniel A. Nelson
bioghist.p: Daniel A. Nelson was a junior high school teacher and director of the Laramie Plains Museum in Laramie, Wyoming. He incorporated the celebration of the Bicentennial into teaching lessons, was involved with local planning of celebrations, and collected Bicentennial Memorabilia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Daniel A. Nelson's Bicentennial memorabilia and souvenirs collected primarily in the Laramie, Wyoming region. The material in this collection is representative of how the region and America celebrated the American Revolution Bicentennial in 1976. Found in the collection are Bicentennial themed calendars, book covers, posters, syrup bottles, soda cans, grocery bags, commemorative plates, tshirts and a flag. Also Included in this collection are desk calendars, placemats, mobiles, pencils, bumper stickers, sugar packets, potholders, reproductions of the U.S. Constitution, stickers, Town meeting posters, newspaper clippings, correspondence, bicentennial merchandise catalogs, miscellaneous bicentennial era newspapers and periodicals as well as Laramie Bicentennial materials. An assortment of subject files in this collection relate to Dan Nelson's Bicentennial era high school curriculum and include headings such as "Bicentennial ideas from students", "Buffalo project", "Bikecentennial", "Fire hydrant projects", "Contests", "My America contest", "Junior committee of correspondence", "Bicentennial youth debates" and National Educational Association Bicentennial plans". These subject files also include various educational material catalogs and educational newsletters such as "Bicentennial Times". This collection also contains bicentennial era brochures, pamphlets, publications, tourism brochures, and popular culture magazines and catalogs from the bicentennial era.

accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply. Donor assumes copyright when applicable.

userestrict.head: Statement on Potentially Harmful Language and Images Found in Collections
userestrict.p: The American Heritage Center aspires to approach all areas of our work in ways that are respectful to those who create, use, and are represented in our collections. For a variety of reasons, however, users may encounter offensive or harmful language or images in some of our finding aids, catalogs, and collection materials.

Note that the AHC does not censor or alter contents of the collections as they provide context and evidence of a time, people, place, or event. Therefore, we encourage users to bring questions and concerns about descriptions in our finding aids to our attention via email or anonymous web-form. For more information, read our full statement.

relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by at the date of processing.

acqinfo.p: This collection was donated by Daniel A. Nelson in multiple accretions from 1986-1999.

processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Laura Uglean Jackson in August 2009

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: American Revolution Bicentennial Commission of Wyoming
controlaccess.subject: American Revolution Bicentennial, 1976 -- Wyoming -- Laramie

scopecontent.p: This series includes materials created (in one way or another) for the Bicentennial celebration. In addition to calendars, published articles, and memorabilia, there is information on events, tourist attractions, merchandise, and teaching lessons. The subject files include publications, correspondence, events, and event planning documents created by the American Revolution Bicentennial Administration and Commission.

did.unittitle: Merchandise and Products Relating to the Bicentennial
University of Wyoming Events and Material

scopecontent.p: Contains calenders, teaching materials, publications, mail-order catalogs, tourism brochures, University of Wyoming materials, and information on Wyoming.

did.unittitle: Laramie High School and Teaching Material
